thread.title: Grammy Awards 2017 FAQ: Where to watch on TV and online; red carpet; and who’s performing
thread.title_full: Grammy Awards 2017 FAQ: Where to watch on TV and online; red carpet; and who’s performing

author: Emily Yahr
title: Grammy Awards 2017 FAQ: Where to watch on TV and online; red carpet; and who’s performing
text:
10:41 PM February 12 by Emily Yahr Beyoncé performs during the Formation World Tour at Marlins Park in April 2016 in Miami. (Frank Micelotta/Invision for Parkwood Entertainment/Associated Press) 
Where to watch on TV: 
The 59th annual Grammy Awards will air on CBS at 8 p.m. Eastern time on Feb. 12. 
For only the second time, the show will also air live on the West Coast . 
Where to watch online: 
If you have a subscription to CBS All Access (the network has an option to get a one-week free trial), you can live-stream the show here on your phone, laptop, tablet, Roku, etc. 
What time the show’s over: 
11:30 p.m., allegedly. 
“Carpool Karaoke”/”Late Late Show” host James Corden, taking over for LL Cool J. 
Who’s performing: 
Look for Beyoncé, Adele, Katy Perry, Bruno Mars, Chance the Rapper and Sturgill Simpson to get solo performing slots, followed by tons of collaborations, including Lady Gaga and Metallica; the Weeknd and Daft Punk; Carrie Underwood and Keith Urban; William Bell and Guy Clark Jr.; Lukas Graham and Kelsea Ballerini; Alicia Keys and Maren Morris; and Anderson .Paak and A Tribe Called Quest. 
Plus, John Legend and Cynthia Erivo will pay tribute to musicians who died this past year, while Demi Lovato, Andra Day, Little Big Town and Tori Kelly celebrate the music of the Bee Gees and the 40th anniversary of “Saturday Night Fever.” CBS also promises special tributes for George Michael and Prince, though the details are under wraps. Who’s going to win: 
Beyoncé? Maybe Adele? Queen Bey leads the field with nine nominations for “Lemonade” album, though Rihanna, Drake and Kanye West are close behind with eight nods. (Drake is not attending the show ; Kanye is still a maybe .) 
The red carpet: 
As usual, the stars begin arriving on E! at 6 p.m., while CBS kicks off its red carpet special (hosted by Nancy O’Dell and Kevin Frazier) at 7:30 p.m. 
Judging the fashion: 
A special edition of “Fashion Police” airs Feb. 13 on E! at 8 p.m., with a thorough critique of all the ensembles.
